articles.title: Santa Claus Deserted the Market. It’s Still Been a Good Year for Stocks.
articles.content: Investors are still sitting on a more than 25% gain for the year, and it’s arguable that the frenzied postelection bump pulled forward some of December’s typical gains. Nonetheless, the month’s anemic showing is atypical.

articles.title: Big Tech's legal battles: What to watch for in 2025
articles.content: The US government spent much of 2024 cracking down on tech giants like Google (GOOGL, GOOG), Apple (AAPL), and Meta (META). The efforts started under former President Trump and then carried over into President Biden’s administration. Yahoo Finance senior legal reporter Alexis Keenan appears on Market Domination to discuss key events, including the DOJ's victory in its antitrust case against Google and what to watch for in 2025 as Trump takes office again.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

articles.title: Tech Slide Weighs on U.S. Stocks
articles.content: Major indexes, which had barely budged Thursday, remained on track to finish little changed for the week—and are closing in on strong full-year gains.

articles.title: Apple investors may want to brace for a sell-off
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) shares are up about 8% over the past month. But BTIG chief market technician Jonathan Krinsky is warning investors about a potential sell-off in the stock. Krinsky notes that when Apple has posted five straight weeks of gains of more than 2%, the stock tends to fall over the following six weeks. Morning Brief Hosts Brad Smith and Brian Sozzi discuss the call in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Stephanie Mikulich.

articles.title: 2024 Stock Market News: The Year At A Glance
articles.content: Boosted by AI trends, Apple and other Mag 7 stocks notched all-time highs as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq enjoyed record years.

articles.title: Mag 7 is turning to 'lag 7': How to play tech in 2025
articles.content: Piper Sandler managing director and chief market technician Craig Johnson joins Josh Lipton on Market Domination. He suggests that, although stocks like Apple are trending upward, the "Magnificent Seven" — which comprises Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL) — may become the "lag seven" in 2025 as "the relative performance has not been nearly as strong." Johnson shares his strategy for navigating the shifting tech landscape in the coming year. "I would rather see investors — and I suspect this will happen as you get into early 2025 — taking some, not all, but some of their profits out of those larger cap stocks, reducing those positions, and then again, recognizing some of those gains that they may not have wanted to recognize in 2024 and [shifting] down cap, looking at stocks like Twilio (TWLO)." He also highlights Robinhood (HOOD) as an opportunity for investors, given the "more friendly crypto policy from the new administration." Johnson advises viewers not to forget optical companies, like Coherent (COHR), which "could be a better place to put some money to work." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

articles.title: Apple May be First to a $4 Trillion Market Cap. Will It Hold?
articles.content: Apple stock needs to close at or above $264.623 for the iphone maker to reach a $4 trillion market cap.
